name: Bifrost Orbital
headline: 24/7 and real-time connectivity for satellites
description:
At Bifrost Orbital, we're building the future of satellite connectivity.

Our mission is to eliminate communication blackouts and dead spots in orbit by providing an always-on, continuous connectivity service for satellites and other spacecraft in low Earth orbit. We're building an optical relay network of satellites to provide 24/7 uplink and downlink support to other satellites in orbit, with increased uptime and higher data rates for TT&C and more.

founders.name: Onkar Singh, Founder and CEO
founders.description: Onkar is the Co-founder and CEO of Bifrost Orbital. He led InQube, India's first open-source satellite mission, specializing in system design, firmware, and software-defined radios, with 4+ years in the space industry. At 16, he developed and validated a multiplexing radio system for a radio based relay network.

founders.name: Geffen Avraham, Co-founder and CTO
founders.description: Geffen is the Co-founder, CTO of Bifrost Orbital. He was involved in Duchifat-3, a CubeSat mission, leading him to become the only high-schooler invited to an academic space conference in China. At 16, he left school to pursue his passion for building satellites at a local laboratory.

### Meet the Founders.
## Meet the Founders.
Founded in **2024** , Bifrost Orbital brings together two teenagers who, at 16, independently developed satellites in different countries.
Founded in **2024** , Bifrost Orbital brings together two teenagers who, at 16, independently developed satellites in different countries.
Founded in **2024** , Bifrost Orbital brings together two teenagers who, at 16, independently developed satellites in different countries.
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/nxYTohn4Fjiz2aGOljnHeTXYt9E.png)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/nxYTohn4Fjiz2aGOljnHeTXYt9E.png)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/gfGodfyRR6qN24MzzxIOIbVeD9c.png)
##### Onkar Singh
##### Onkar Singh
##### Onkar Singh
Co-Founder, CEO
Onkar is a serial technologist who has previously focused on developing miniaturized satellite technologies, including InQube, an open-source satellite mission in India. He is a President's Awardee and a Rise Fellow, an initiative by Schmidt Futures and Rhodes Trust. Onkar’s primary interests lie in space radios and chemical based power systems for small satellites.
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/afQo1TTA92op0kjW0EaauvWrtY.png)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/5opoGm4GA6qM0FMZ7rz6Oz3M.png)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/5opoGm4GA6qM0FMZ7rz6Oz3M.png)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/afQo1TTA92op0kjW0EaauvWrtY.png)
##### Geffen Avraham
##### Geffen Avraham
##### Geffen Avraham
Co-Founder, CTO
Geffen is a space technologist and a Thiel Fellow who has previously worked on developing modular and inexpensive commercial satellite buses. He contributed to Duchifat-3, a CubeSat mission, which led to him becoming the only high school student invited to an academic space conference in China. Geffen's interests lie in space based lasers and scaling miniaturized subsystems.

generated_description:
**Bifrost Orbital: Revolutionizing Satellite Connectivity**

Founded in 2024 and hailing from San Francisco, Bifrost Orbital is a newcomer in the satellite telecommunications space. Its mission? To eradicate communication blackouts and dead zones in low Earth orbit with a seamless and uninterrupted connectivity solution. This is not just ambitious—it's essential for the ever-growing demands of satellite communication.

### What Do They Do?

Bifrost Orbital is building an optical relay network that offers 24/7 uplink and downlink support for satellites. They're about making satellite communication as easy as pie, enabling users to connect and downlink with the precision of SSH and cURL commands. That’s right: continuous, real-time connectivity without the hassle of traditional intermittent connections. They aim to standardize real-time communication in the industry, which is currently far from reliable.

### Key Features

1. **Always-On Connectivity**: They promise 99% uptime with around 1,700% connectivity—making signal loss a thing of the past.
   
2. **Backward Compatibility**: Their relay system can integrate with satellites across generations without the need for extensive modifications.

3. **Power Efficiency**: Bifrost’s solutions enable connections with minimal power draw, an essential factor for satellites operating in space.

4. **Network Interoperability**: They facilitate communication between satellites using different protocols and systems, paving the way for a more unified satellite network.

### The Team Behind the Tech

At the helm are two remarkable co-founders, Onkar Singh and Geffen Avraham, both of whom are young prodigies in space technology. Onkar is a serial technologist with a background in miniaturized satellite tech, while Geffen has experience in developing affordable commercial satellite systems. Their shared passion for space and unique insights into satellite operation fuel Bifrost’s mission.

### Investor Backing

Bifrost Orbital is part of the prestigious Y Combinator Batch F24, providing them not just with funding but also with invaluable mentorship and resources to help navigate the complexities of the tech landscape.

### Why Bifrost Matters

In an era where global connectivity is paramount, and satellites are central to everything from navigation to data communications, Bifrost Orbital is not just another tech startup. They're attempting to change the game—removing reliability issues and enhancing real-time communication globally.

If you're curious or looking to collaborate, Bifrost invites you to [get in touch](https://bifrostorbital.com/#contact) with them. 

In short, Bifrost Orbital is on a path to make satellite communication easier, faster, and significantly more reliable. They're not just dreaming of a future where connectivity is constant—they're building it. Watch this space.
